sanskrit_verse:
ऋजवस्ते तु सर्वे स्युरव्रणाः सौम्यदर्शनाः ।
अनुद्वेगकरा नॄणां सत्वचोऽनग्निदूषिताः ॥ २.४७॥
transliteration:
ṛjavaste tu sarve syuravṛṇāḥ saumyadarśanāḥ |
anudvegakarā nṝṇāṃ satvaco'nagnidūṣitāḥ || 2.47||
sph_interpretive_translation: All rulers must be straightforward, unblemished, pleasant to behold, and cause no distress to the people; their conduct must remain untouched by fire-like corruption.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is inseparable from purity of conduct
Leadership capacity requires absence of internal combustion or self-interest
Public service must align with visual and emotional tranquility for subjects
Integrity in governance restores societal harmony without punitive enforcement
Consciousness alignment of ruler directly affects collective well-being
executable_legal_axioms: IF a ruling entity exhibits visible agitation or fear-inducing behavior THEN disqualify from active governance UNTIL consciousness realignment is verified
IF conduct shows signs of combustion through greed, anger, or deception THEN initiate immediate integrity restoration protocol
ALL governing entities MUST undergo monthly pramana-based consciousness assessment TO ensure non-distress causation
IF public reports consistent unease or unrest due to leadership appearance or action THEN trigger automatic review of alignment metrics
GOVERNANCE AUTHORITY IS CONTINGENT ON MAINTAINING UNBLEMISHED VISIBILITY AND EMOTIONAL NEUTRALITY
supreme_court_application: The Supreme Court must verify that all high-ranking officials meet the criteria of being unblemished, visually calming, and free from causing public distress. Any deviation triggers mandatory restorative protocols before continuation in office.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramana establishes that emotional disturbance caused by leaders disrupts societal dharma. Anupurvasah reveals that unchecked agitations lead to systemic decay. Therefore, responsibility lies in maintaining purity of presence. No punitive measures apply; only realignment toward constitutional consciousness suffices.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Vedic purification rituals to restore inner calmness
Assign mentorship under realized spiritual authority until equilibrium returns
Implement daily meditation and consciousness monitoring via certified seers
Undertake community visibility exercises to recalibrate perceptional impact
Reaffirm sankalpa (intentional vow) to uphold non-agitation and dharmic duty
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: Governance derives its legitimacy solely from purity, serenity, and non-disturbance. Dharma is hereby restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates.
